chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Bahr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
1 day time served.
Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The last 5 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment, Day Reporting Center and Electronic Monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT:  The Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as stipulated by the parties.  This case predates the change in law.
Pay all costs and surcharges, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: FORTHWITH. Huber privileges for work ONLY.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served.
 Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The last 5 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment, Day Reporting Center and Electronic Monitoring.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served. Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. 

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:  As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for work ONLY. 

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Anger Management.

- The Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as stipulated by the parties.  This case predates the change in law.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel in trial in another court and requests new date.   Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 1:30 pm.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on October 19, 2015 at 1:30 in Branch 26.

Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.

filed, Count 1: Resisting an Officer, contrary to sec. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats, a Class A Misdemeanor. Count 2: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to sec. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b) Wis. Stats, a Class B Misdemeanor.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial conference held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on October 7, 2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 26.

State's Requested Jury Instructions filed.

Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case calendared for projected guilty plea.  Defense counsel requests new date.  Court ordered case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
To reschedule Projected guilty plea hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 8:30 am.  New date is August 14, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Lucy Kronforst for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kastenson
informs court that he is retiring from the PD's office.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed with court.

Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Catelin Ringersma for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant to have ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, and not to be in possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant Brandon L Bahr in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (02-05-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
